text: WENTY INTH UNDAY IN RDINARY IME October 18 2020 This weekend Oct 17th 18th marks the 29th Sunday in Ordinary Time Our readings continue to prepare us for coming of the fifth and final discourse of St Matthews Gospel on the End Times We can however see a slight shift in thematic We do not need to fear the end as Jesus is the end We belong to Him As Christians this becomes the source of our hope and joy That if we live and die with the Lord we too shall rise with Him In the end we have nothing to fear because Christ Himself is with us ARISH PDATES AND PCOMING VENTS This past week weve had several unexpected repairs popup around the parish As we begin to shift our campus from Summer to Winter mode that is not uncommon What a joy it is to know that when these unexpected expenses arise we are prepared to face them thanks to your continued generosity to the monthly Repair Rainy Day Fund Thank you for your financial stewardship and support of our parish to help ensure that we have the facilities to serve all those who come through our doors for the years to come Speaking on generous financial stewardship our stewardship in the Annual Bishops Appeal allows us to reach beyond our own parish and offers assistance to an innumerable number of people throughout northernIndiana As you know we are striving to have as close to 100 participation for this years Appeal as possible As of this week weve already received pledge cards from 40 of our parish families Were well on our way to 100 participation If you havent yet had the opportunity to return your pledge please try and do so at your earliest convenience We will be sending out a second round of mailings to those who have not yet had a chance to respond Even if you may not be in a position to financially support the appeal this year please still return your pledge card so that we know that it was received Returning the pledge card will also help save the parish on postage in the longrun Thank you for your support both spiritually and financially for the 34th Annual Bishops Appeal Its amazing to think that as the end of the liturgical year nears the beginning of Advent is only several weeks away Planning for Advent and Christmas will be a bit different this year but we will still be striving to do everything that we can to prepare together as a parish family to celebrate the Incarnation of Jesus Christ Leading up to Advent on Tuesday November 17th at 6:30PM members of our liturgical decorating committee will host a Make Your Own Advent Wreath event See this bulletin for more information and the signup sheet in the narthex For those unable to yet join us in person for events mailhome kits with instructions will be available Mark your calendars for our Advent Parish Mission We will welcome our own Fr Stephen Felicichia now parochial vicar of St Elizabeth Ann Seton in Fort Wayne to lead us in our Advent preparations each evening at 7:00PM from Monday Dec 7th through Wednesday Dec 9th Our Advent Parish Mission will be held in the Church with accommodations in the Parish Social Hall for overflow seating if necessary For those who may not be able to yet join us in person each evening of the Parish Mission will also be livestreamed Faithfully in Christ Fr David MASS INTENTIONS Saturday October 17 8:00am Special Intention 4:00pm Confessions 4:35pm Rosary 5:00pm Rose Ann Lautzenheiser Sunday October 18 TwentyNinth Sunday in Ordinary Time 7:10am Rosary 7:30am Parish Family 9:40am Rosary 10:00am Robert Rose Marie Bates 12:10pm Rosary 12:30pm Special Intention Monday Oct 24St Anthony Mary Claret Bishop Eph 4716 Lk 1319 Sun Oct 25 Thirtieth Sunday in Ordinary Time Ex 222026 1 Thes 15c10 Mt 2234 40 NOTE FROM THE DIOCESE It remains important for our Church to protect children and young persons from the evils of abuse The Diocese of Fort WayneSouth Bend remains committed to upholding and following its guidelines policies and procedures that were implemented for the Protection of Children and Young People These can be reviewed on the Dioceses website www.diocesefwsb.org under Youth Protection If you have reason to believe that a minor may be a victim of abuse or neglect Indiana law requires that you report this to civil authori ties If you or someone you know was abused as a child or young person by an adult you are encouraged to notify appropriate civil authorities of that abuse In addition if the alleged abuser is or was a priest or deacon of the Catholic Church you are encouraged to con tact Mary Glowaski Victim Assistance Coordinator 260 3991458 email mglowaskidiocesefwsb.org or Rev Mark Gurtner Vicar General of the Diocese of Fort WayneSouth Bend at PO Box 390 Fort Wayne Indiana 46801 or at 260 3991419 email mgurt nerdiocesefwsb.org The Diocese is committed to helping prevent the abuse or neglect of children and young people and to assist those who claim to have suffered harm as a result of such abuse PARISH CALENDAR Sat Oct 17 Mass Memorial Candles and put on the desk in the narthex or drop them by the parish office They will be displayed the month of November in memory of the Poor Souls in Purgatory YOUNG ADULT COOKOUT The St Joseph Young Adult Group will be resuming their monthly gatherings with a cookout on Sunday October 18th from 5:00PM 6:00PM behind the Parish Rectory All young adults 1840 are welcome to join us for dinner provided by the Parish and fraternity One pint can save up to three lives Please join the Knights of Columbus as we travel up to Ft Wayne on Saturday October 24th to pray at the 40 Days for Life cam paign in front of the Planned Parenthood at 2930 Lake Ave We will leave the church parking lot at 900AM for anyone who would like to carpool with us We will pray from 1000AM 1100AM and will be back at the church around 12Noon All are welcome to stand up for the Most Vulnerable Unborn Tuesday November 17 6:30pm in the Social Hall Wreath Kits are 20 per household Includes Candles Wreath
